definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly

sentences.english: Impartially enforcing the law and effectively safeguarding the legitimate rights and interests of taxpayers.
sentences.chinese: 秉公执法，切实维护纳税人的合法权益。

sentences.english: Administrative law enforcers shall enforce law impartially.
sentences.chinese: 行政执法人员应当秉公执法。

sentences.english: Article 44 The judicial officers shall deal with all cases impartially and in accordance with the law.
sentences.chinese: 第四十四条审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: Because of the Lord 's eternal love for Israel, he has made you king, to maintain justice and righteousness.'
sentences.chinese: 因为他永远爱以色列，所以立你作王，使你秉公行义。

sentences.english: So David reigned over all Israel, and he administered justice and equity to all his people.
sentences.chinese: 大卫作以色列众人的王，又向众民秉公行义。

sentences.english: And David reigned over all Israel; and David executed judgment and justice unto all his people.
sentences.chinese: 大卫作以色列众人的王，又向众民秉公行义。

sentences.english: David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people.
sentences.chinese: 大卫作以色列众人的王，又向众民秉公行义。

sentences.english: Article 44 The adjudicating personnel shall handle the case impartially and according to law.
sentences.chinese: 第四十四条审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: Article 44 The judicial personnel shall handle the case impartially and in accordance with the law.
sentences.chinese: 第四十四条审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.
sentences.chinese: 大卫作以色列众人的王，又向众民秉公行义。

sentences.english: Judges shall hanDle cases impartially and in accordance with the law.
sentences.chinese: 审判人员应当依法秉公办案。

sentences.english: Open your mouth, judge righteously; defend the rights of the poor and needy.
sentences.chinese: 你要开口说话，秉公审判，为困苦和穷乏的人伸冤。

sentences.english: Grassland supervisors and inspectors shall be devoted to their duties and enforce laws impartially.
sentences.chinese: 草原监督检查人员应当忠于职守，秉公执法。

sentences.english: Relevant administrative personnel shall observe disciplines and abide by laws, and shall enforce the law impartially.
sentences.chinese: 有关行政管理人员应当遵纪守法，秉公执法。

sentences.english: As a leader, he must handle a matter impartially.
sentences.chinese: 作为领导，他必须秉公办事。

sentences.english: The functionaries of water supervision and inspection shall be devoted to their duties and enforce the law impartially.
sentences.chinese: 水政监督检查人员应当忠于职守，秉公执法。

definition: conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly
desire for the public good/sense of fair play
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to maintain the law as firm as a mountain (idiom); to enforce the law strictly
